document.title: InTASC Model Core Teaching Standards and Learning Progressions for Teachers 1.0

jurisdiction.title: Council of Chief State School Officers

0DD6D7037A7C4C588344F3E22F7356C5.description: The teacher embraces the challenge of continuous improvement and change.

5948A4EA8A15466FB3171F2C74279DA6.description: The teacher takes responsibility for contributing to and advancing the profession.

DFA3A88C2E4342D1929F60F66130CC7F.description: The teacher takes initiative to grow and develop with colleagues through interactions that enhance practice and support student learning.

39BF904949A243F79860ADF37A0B6972.description: The teacher respects families’ beliefs, norms, and expectations and seeks to work collaboratively with learners and families in setting and meeting challenging goals.

1B747C5C1B2948DF9EA18684F8D227E9.description: The teacher actively shares responsibility for shaping and supporting the mission of his/her school as one of advocacy for learners and accountability for their success.

7BA7C214207B44FDB2C0F5C89A890716.description: The teacher knows how to contribute to a common culture that supports high expectations for student learning.

5CDB0507B01847CC87D72D534B1BB692.description: The teacher knows how to work with other adults and has developed skills in collaborative interaction appropriate for both face-to-face and virtual contexts.

FA716D8D57064A51B5E98BF9958E93EA.description: The teacher understands that alignment of family, school, and community spheres of infl uence enhances student learning and that discontinuity in these spheres of infl uence interferes with learning.

C596EB7B07E14529A556DAE71B43A0F3.description: The teacher understands schools as organizations within a historical, cultural, political, and social context and knows how to work with others across the system to support learners.

DF2882E573E04CF79A14010F3F213CCC.description: The teacher takes on leadership roles at the school, district, state, and/or national level and advocates for learners, the school, the community, and the profession.

CE040CA6E32E43CBB175D8160B74D2F4.description: The teacher advocates to meet the needs of learners, to strengthen the learning environment, and to enact system change

7F58A21E00DD46E3AEA33EEB83C85664.description: The teacher seeks appropriate opportunities to model effective practice for colleagues, to lead professional learning activities, and to serve in other leadership roles.

98FBE499368A46A7B989A16113D92072.description: The teacher uses and generates meaningful research on education issues and policies

ECB3FF5E0FD14DEE8ED1135D88DABA3D.description: The teacher uses technological tools and a variety of communication strategies to build local and global learning communities that engage learners, families, and colleagues.

236D19D8A087478CBDF50EF9102D414F.description: The teacher engages in professional learning, contributes to the knowledge and skill of others, and works collaboratively to advance professional practice

D842DEAC8B7F481982387DF8BF5D19DE.description: Working with school colleagues, the teacher builds ongoing connections with community resources to enhance student learning and well being.

B429261639FA4973A62C09B4E213B529.description: The teacher works collaboratively with learners and their families to establish mutual expectations and ongoing communication to support learner development and achievement

59FACB4D0F3740C4BFDBA78DF849E416.description: The teacher engages collaboratively in the school-wide effort to build a shared vision and supportive culture, identify common goals, and monitor and evaluate progress toward those goals

D8648135779A4896BFDD57BFE53AFC92.description: The teacher works with other school professionals to plan and jointly facilitate learning on how to meet diverse needs of learners.

88A98B747DDF4121B20EF3A56EBA4596.description: The teacher takes an active role on the instructional team, giving and receiving feedback on practice, examining learner work, analyzing data from multiple sources, and sharing responsibility for decision making and accountability for each student’s learning.

E28450530FF84FC48462E3F8B09EBB48.description: Leadership and Collaboration:The teacher seeks appropriate leadership roles and opportunities to take responsibility for student learning, to collaborate with learners, families, colleagues, other school professionals, and community members to ensure learner growth, and to advance the

07CE5F6AA5B145EDA10304F4B94C5F55.description: The teacher understands the expectations of the profession including codes of ethics, professional standards of practice, and relevant law and policy.

173B607390D34ABA9F790F1C0113DB92.description: The teacher sees him/herself as a learner, continuously seeking opportunities to draw upon current education policy and research as sources of analysis and refl ection to improve practice.

36D1952CF979492C939B825F40BBD571.description: The teacher is committed to deepening understanding of his/her own frames of reference (e.g., culture, gender, language, abilities, ways of knowing), the potential biases in these frames, and their impact on expectations for and relationships with learners and their families.

A43EE82770734467A3DA21970CC0B0FC.description: The teacher takes responsibility for student learning and uses ongoing analysis and refl ection to improve planning and practice.

31A33DE18A014A94BD355654CCB27BA8.description: The teacher knows how to build and implement a plan for professional growth directly aligned with his/her needs as a growing professional using feedback from teacher evaluations and observations, data on learner performance, and school- and system-wide priorities.

98432DCB9614424A87FCB72E69E2DC99.description: The teacher understands laws related to learners’ rights and teacher responsibilities (e.g., for educational equity, appropriate education for learners with disabilities, confi dentiality, privacy, appropriate treatment of learners, reporting in situations related to possible child abuse).

A63A96709EB7486591CEA0689ADE45E4.description: The teacher understands how personal identity, worldview, and prior experience affect perceptions and expectations, and recognizes how they may bias behaviors and interactions with others.

FC46C04E77774EE3A80D2A0A02832EF7.description: The teacher knows how to use learner data to analyze practice and differentiate instruction accordingly.

EB968E8DC17F4CF587BD3D920FFE395F.description: The teacher understands and knows how to use a variety of self-assessment and problem-solving strategies to analyze and refl ect on his/her practice and to plan for adaptations/adjustments

952A7DCA5F874D5DAC69128B7B1BAA1B.description: The teacher advocates, models, and teaches safe, legal, and ethical use of information and technology including appropriate documentation of sources and respect for others in the use of social media.

489EC4EC887F4A7C89E385EAE639844F.description: The teacher reflects on his/her personal biases and accesses resources to deepen his/her own understanding of cultural, ethnic, gender, and learning differences to build stronger relationships and create more relevant learning experiences.

CCBD880A9F2041DA986791A0A1527FE6.description: The teacher actively seeks professional, community, and technological resources, within and outside the school, as supports for analysis, reflection, and problem-solving.

BBB55832E23240D8B692E882D7FA5308.description: Independently and in collaboration with colleagues, the teacher uses a variety of data (e.g., systematic observation, information about learners, research) to evaluate the outcomes of teaching and learning and to adapt planning and practice.

FA1771C50A8C4899818899145D9EBD5E.description: The teacher engages in meaningful and appropriate professional learning experiences aligned with his/her own needs and the needs of the learners, school, and system.

98102EE157A740D48696099BB2E2BDBC.description: The teacher engages in ongoing learning opportunities to develop knowledge and skills in order to provide all learners with engaging curriculum and learning experiences based on local and state standards

A290948ECD7A4AD693AFF79314C9C908.description: Professional Learning and Ethical Practice: The teacher engages in ongoing professional learning and uses evidence to continually evaluate his/her practice, particularly the effects of his/her choices and actions on others (learners, families, other professionals, and the community), and adapts practice to meet the needs of each learner.

52F6473FD4A8498A97B9B3372B433880.description: The teacher values fl exibility and reciprocity in the teaching process as necessary for adapting instruction to learner responses, ideas, and needs.

F2FB61F7DEFD425591284A122DEF308F.description: The teacher is committed to exploring how the use of new and emerging technologies can support and promote student learning

C40C806FED9945A8A1F2BC6F7CD8B2AC.description: The teacher values the variety of ways people communicate and encourages learners to develop and use multiple forms of communication.

A944F6D2E5794AC6A2F1B844B482CB53.description: The teacher is committed to deepening awareness and understanding the strengths and needs of diverse learners when planning and adjusting instruction.

0D7C56AC29C24629A01CE2FB6E0EDFBA.description: The teacher understands how content and skill development can be supported by media and technology and knows how to evaluate these resources for quality, accuracy, and effectiveness.

D4645DFB732443BF8EECCA18FFB0881E.description: The teacher knows how to use a wide variety of resources, including human and technological, to engage students in learning.

CD32176D35874349B44AF43A0D1BBFD0.description: The teacher understands how multiple forms of communication (oral, written, nonverbal, digital, visual) convey ideas, foster self expression, and build relationships.

50BEA289DD6E4EF9946806AAAA93617E.description: The teacher knows when and how to use appropriate strategies to differentiate instruction and engage all learners in complex thinking and meaningful tasks.

116033041C59439B92DEBD17AFED7881.description: The teacher knows how to apply a range of developmentally, culturally, and linguistically appropriate instructional strategies to achieve learning goals.

AEC0189161C448A5801ADFE2ACD93FFC.description: The teacher understands the cognitive processes associated with various kinds of learning (e.g., critical and creative thinking, problem framing and problem solving, invention, memorization and recall) and how these processes can be stimulated.

FA797D0CDE474971A20E3E8960CC380F.description: The teacher asks questions to stimulate discussion that serves different purposes (e.g., probing for learner understanding, helping learners articulate their ideas and thinking processes, stimulating curiosity, and helping learners to question).

466B6338EEB6410F97E50F9120587707.description: The teacher uses a variety of instructional strategies to support and expand learners’ communication through speaking, listening, reading, writing, and other modes.

7F0AC23CF199441BA718B5E9DCE0A028.description: The teacher engages learners in using a range of learning skills and technology tools to access, interpret, evaluate, and apply information.

9C2DBBEBBC27447E86536A1EA5F9C7D8.description: The teacher engages all learners in developing higher order questioning skills and metacognitive processes.

06F6A6DA2610409DB98DC89638221A8A.description: The teacher provides multiple models and representations of concepts and skills with opportunities for learners to demonstrate their knowledge through a variety of products and performances.

8CD278D47587419C821FE3F0A6CF5B5E.description: The teacher varies his/her role in the instructional process (e.g., instructor, facilitator, coach, audience) in relation to the content and purposes of instruction and the needs of learners.

13E26CEAE57D4C77BBCE7DEBDF958125.description: The teacher collaborates with learners to design and implement relevant learning experiences, identify their strengths, and access family and community resources to develop their areas of interest.

704D0C20E89B451698BE4F16D91D37F8.description: The teacher continuously monitors student learning, engages learners in assessing their progress, and adjusts instruction in response to student learning needs.

FF362191B33949B98D409ED3C4493C6B.description: The teacher uses appropriate strategies and resources to adapt instruction to the needs of individuals and groups of learners.

99232744BE294CF2BA58485283EEC936.description: Instructional Strategies: The teacher understands and uses a variety of instructional strategies to encourage learners to develop deep understanding of content areas and their connections, and to build skills to apply knowledge in meaningful ways.

D6F5C896197147EFBD32120A4D138E45.description: The teacher believes that plans must always be open to adjustment and revision based on learner needs and changing circumstances.

F1734E6DF57A44BFA207AF68DA455B93.description: The teacher takes professional responsibility to use short- and long-term planning as a means of assuring student learning.

4FCCAB58BB4F481D9C2B9EC446B4B5E6.description: The teacher values planning as a collegial activity that takes into consideration the input of learners, colleagues, families, and the larger community.

724CD750236E4A7FB5FB10D4262E08B8.description: The teacher respects learners’ diverse strengths and needs and is committed to using this information to plan effective instruction.

A3C70B52DC68465599148CD00CD73DC0.description: The teacher knows when and how to access resources and collaborate with others to support student learning (e.g., special educators, related service providers, language learner specialists, librarians, media specialists, community organizations).

F960FE49129849C6B1BEA76C6C3DDF08.description: The teacher knows when and how to adjust plans based on assessment information and learner responses.

53DD8607A8144C0A84F434C64BD977EE.description: The teacher knows a range of evidence-based instructional strategies, resources, and technological tools and how to use them effectively to plan instruction that meets diverse learning needs.

FDB64EC84D154AF2AF98014289981FBD.description: The teacher understands the strengths and needs of individual learners and how to plan instruction that is responsive to these strengths and needs.

297395CBA828442D9CEF1EC7B169B112.description: The teacher understands learning theory, human development, cultural diversity, and individual differences and how these impact ongoing planning.

F107CD6415D84FB394DA53D09EACE234.description: The teacher understands how integrating cross-disciplinary skills in instruction engages learners purposefully in applying content knowledge.

13A54340951E4A2BB69E80C0812C6E37.description: The teacher understands content and content standards and how these are organized in the curriculum.

3029A948737A4250AFE7E3EA324D886F.description: The teacher evaluates plans in relation to short- and long-range goals and systematically adjusts plans to meet each student’s learning needs and enhance learning.

34FACBDF68514B29BAA711293A0B673A.description: The teacher plans collaboratively with professionals who have specialized expertise (e.g., special educators, related service providers, language learning specialists, librarians, media specialists) to design and jointly deliver as appropriate effective learning experiences to meet unique learning needs.

FE81BA5C51B14356987D58566F9B5D5A.description: The teacher plans for instruction based on formative and summative assessment data, prior learner knowledge, and learner interest.

5C57CD1C0BD3463B80EA034C098FD7C4.description: The teacher develops appropriate sequencing of learning experiences and provides multiple ways to demonstrate knowledge and skill.

D9EE9EFC367F478C823696E71EA2E4B0.description: The teacher plans how to achieve each student’s learning goals, choosing appropriate strategies and accommodations, resources, and materials to differentiate instruction for individuals and groups of learners.

CE7395E911DC4EF38BA9C170CA195991.description: The teacher individually and collaboratively selects and creates learning experiences that are appropriate for curriculum goals and content standards, and are relevant to learners

63D36AD55412445B932E83D400BED3B5.description: Planning for Instruction: The teacher plans instruction that supports every student in meeting rigorous learning goals by drawing upon knowledge of content areas, curriculum, cross-disciplinary skills, and pedagogy, as well as knowledge of learners and the community context.

BE87E4F1C2334305A368F459C10F6DF6.description: The teacher is committed to the ethical use of various assessments and assessment data to identify learner strengths and needs to promote learner growth.

DD744063D02547AC9A2F595BDFB0BFDF.description: The teacher is committed to making accommodations in assessments and testing conditions, especially for learners with disabilities and language learning needs.

8FD6F25F40F745939F1848F50AA947D5.description: The teacher is committed to using multiple types of assessment processes to support, verify, and document learning.

8E806A103C0B43CFB29F8157A2F322D0.description: The teacher is committed to providing timely and effective descriptive feedback to learners on their progress.

6E14A4BFE4194BE5BE4C7F7DF1C8B6D4.description: The teacher takes responsibility for aligning instruction and assessment with learning goals.

07B2AFA678BA49059BE02A1A0729C0D1.description: The teacher is committed to engaging learners actively in assessment processes and to developing each learner’s capacity to review and communicate about their own progress and learning

8C9309EFEF7342A5A09A4FFCF82AF98A.description: The teacher understands how to prepare learners for assessments and how to make accommodations in assessments and testing conditions, especially for learners with disabilities and language learning needs.

E442BF75AC4E436584974DA039D87E32.description: The teacher knows when and how to evaluate and report learner progress against standards.

41FF67048C0D47C29818719ECCEA46A8.description: The teacher understands the positive impact of effective descriptive feedback for learners and knows a variety of strategies for communicating this feedback.

1A3FBBF33FB3491CAB4F0CA5480BC93D.description: The teacher knows when and how to engage learners in analyzing their own assessment results and in helping to set goals for their own learning.

3F1AF6A914D14D57A77B9F52C056183F.description: The teacher knows how to analyze assessment data to understand patterns and gaps in learning, to guide planning and instruction, and to provide meaningful feedback to all learners

1F704844D43C436BBC98B65393E7953E.description: The teacher understands the range of types and multiple purposes of assessment and how to design, adapt, or select appropriate assessments to address specifi c learning goals and individual differences, and to minimize sources of bias.

01A2ACD541FC4C759B6A5148DFF68AA7.description: The teacher understands the differences between formative and summative applications of assessment and knows how and when to use each.

11FC501A138B4BE2B9536C3B66995342.description: The teacher continually seeks appropriate ways to employ technology to support assessment practice both to engage learners more fully and to assess and address learner needs.

4B756F64A1DB41A9A297EC60920064C6.description: The teacher prepares all learners for the demands of particular assessment formats and makes appropriate accommodations in assessments or testing conditions, especially for learners with disabilities and language learning needs.

6558CF48CA7B40C0BBF075F83B614B60.description: The teacher effectively uses multiple and appropriate types of assessment data to identify each student’s learning needs and to develop differentiated learning experiences.

BA1A3E4B52864322B160155FF88A6D09.description: The teacher models and structures processes that guide learners in examining their own thinking and learning as well as the performance of others.

9A42C64ECFD64F829EBB42D20D9235E7.description: The teacher engages learners in multiple ways of demonstrating knowledge and skill as part of the assessment process.

49066DDB54A9496BB5DEB26E99D79F90.description: The teacher engages learners in understanding and identifying quality work and provides them with effective descriptive feedback to guide their progress toward that work.

4BED8457CE6E4C9F9F3CB84B0F5EB1C1.description: The teacher works independently and collaboratively to examine test and other performance data to understand each learner’s progress and to guide planning.

9A0952AC7A2F49B8ABA773D15E1DC6FC.description: The teacher designs assessments that match learning objectives with assessment methods and minimizes sources of bias that can distort assessment results.

5E6BB261BCAE4AE8BB2D7D542DC7B008.description: The teacher balances the use of formative and summative assessment as appropriate to support, verify, and document learning.

FAA828B6E5244E28BAADA521AEEF5EC4.description: Assessment: The teacher understands and uses multiple methods of assessment to engage learners in their own growth, to monitor learner progress, and to guide the teacher’s and learner’s decision making.

1FCCEF3C3271465C90F2831B0DD6F9B5.description: The teacher values fl exible learning environments that encourage learner exploration, discovery, and expression across content areas.

9B2B90F5170C48F8B71E0B97BBD80B21.description: The teacher values knowledge outside his/her own content area and how such knowledge enhances student learning.

28BCBDBF7ABD4339AED0F683B519624C.description: The teacher is constantly exploring how to use disciplinary knowledge as a lens to address local and global issues.

55458F6489A54E6F8B7339B06CB6C731.description: The teacher knows where and how to access resources to build global awareness and understanding, and how to integrate them into the curriculum

857DDFF3AEF34EB5A23EA1566885ACCB.description: The teacher understands creative thinking processes and how to engage learners in producing original work.

F2E99A28763C4EE5A76394853880D908.description: The teacher understands communication modes and skills as vehicles for learning (e.g., information gathering and processing) across disciplines as well as vehicles for expressing learning.

998A6C85F9EC4BB084ED3B9D900AA47F.description: The teacher understands critical thinking processes and knows how to help learners develop high level questioning skills to promote their independent learning.

A2D00A388DA041029AD108473328CCEA.description: The teacher understands how to use digital and interactive technologies for effi ciently and effectively achieving specifi c learning goals.

A6C9E828D72F4B729E2236D6012C3960.description: The teacher understands the demands of accessing and managing information as well as how to evaluate issues of ethics and quality related to information and its use.

1830C2F596B04F5EB7DDA03DCE4E9CE6.description: The teacher understands how current interdisciplinary themes (e.g., civic literacy, health literacy, global awareness) connect to the core subjects and knows how to weave those themes into meaningful learning experiences.

13896DB287104848A112E6BB16CC222E.description: The teacher understands the ways of knowing in his/her discipline, how it relates to other disciplinary approaches to inquiry, and the strengths and limitations of each approach in addressing problems, issues, and concerns.

E58F8F677EBC47A39B0172A73E3F4D33.description: The teacher develops and implements supports for learner literacy development across content areas.

E6DD1CB0A4EA4576B18886C8CA8AA9CE.description: The teacher facilitates learners’ ability to develop diverse social and cultural perspectives that expand their understanding of local and global issues and create novel approaches to solving problems.

9C4ADDDCF9C94AE697E98D7F8DBB6D0A.description: The teacher engages learners in generating and evaluating new ideas and novel approaches, seeking inventive solutions to problems, and developing original work.

A8EC02D3432040A9A90D78779CC995A8.description: The teacher develops learners’ communication skills in disciplinary and interdisciplinary contexts by creating meaningful opportunities to employ a variety of forms of communication that address varied audiences and purposes.

06763196ECD34C80A6F6516C8C1CD307.description: The teacher engages learners in questioning and challenging assumptions and approaches in order to foster innovation and problem solving in local and global contexts.

63FF5BD9EA7F4FF5A63D5490574AE493.description: The teacher facilitates learners’ use of current tools and resources to maximize content learning in varied contexts.

F464E9BD6F524B669743A84B042CD632.description: The teacher engages learners in applying content knowledge to real world problems through the lens of interdisciplinary themes (e.g., fi nancial literacy, environmental literacy).

8B5638DD11D54F60B63F32D52C318FF9.description: The teacher develops and implements projects that guide learners in analyzing the complexities of an issue or question using perspectives from varied disciplines and cross-disciplinary skills (e.g., a water quality study that draws upon biology and chemistry to look at factual information and social studies to examine policy implications).

07F94FFE09F44FD08402CE301148ED83.description: The teacher is committed to work toward each learner’s mastery of disciplinary content and skills.

78871FA753A04B9D837F383C28108738.description: The teacher recognizes the potential of bias in his/her representation of the discipline and seeks to appropriately address problems of bias.

7174B1CE21194479BF88BAE2CD1E4D91.description: The teacher appreciates multiple perspectives within the discipline and facilitates learners’ critical analysis of these perspectives.

14569B118E0642DEB0E7FBD194044E27.description: The teacher realizes that content knowledge is not a fi xed body of facts but is complex, culturally situated, and ever evolving. S/he keeps abreast of new ideas and understandings in the field.

D5152B579F4046F4B5C169927D5ED62C.description: The teacher has a deep knowledge of student content standards and learning progressions in the discipline(s) s/he teaches.

AF3603F5A5824A07B1F1FA8FD38AB666.description: The teacher knows how to integrate culturally relevant content to build on learners’ background knowledge.

30BAFA09D6CF4BBEA4F2390198B75243.description: The teacher knows and uses the academic language of the discipline and knows how to make it accessible to learners.

174A784804E74C2DB454A0617366AA81.description: The teacher understands common misconceptions in learning the discipline and how to guide learners to accurate conceptual understanding.

D38BA6C315154D4CBA4D28416F21203A.description: The teacher understands major concepts, assumptions, debates, processes of inquiry, and ways of knowing that are central to the discipline(s) s/he teaches.

2012ECD74BD9491C90F1D9EFCD301A9E.description: The teacher accesses school and/or district-based resources to evaluate the learner’s content knowledge in their primary language.

0E47B3661E014064AE15B8027C637167.description: The teacher creates opportunities for students to learn, practice, and master academic language in their content.

152B20A61A534E46BF2A2C755D43A191.description: The teacher uses supplementary resources and technologies effectively to ensure accessibility and relevance for all learners.

163035843DCD478DB823EF2AA814958A.description: The teacher evaluates and modifi es instructional resources and curriculum materials for their comprehensiveness, accuracy for representing particular concepts in the discipline, and appropriateness for his/her learners

03047595355946BD95F62AC2D57D3EFE.description: The teacher stimulates learner refl ection on prior content knowledge, links new concepts to familiar concepts, and makes connections to learners’ experiences.

40CFF96280484A0294048F9FEB81E298.description: The teacher stimulates learner refl ection on prior content knowledge, links new concepts to familiar concepts, and makes connections to learners’ experiences.

B983D166FFDF4744B0ADB9309D2345A3.description: The teacher engages learners in applying methods of inquiry and standards of evidence used in the discipline.

53485107EBF5446E91144FFCB72ADFDE.description: The teacher engages students in learning experiences in the discipline(s) that encourage learners to understand, question, and analyze ideas from diverse perspectives so that they master the content.

E895840B54E045458DD5660050EAB06B.description: The teacher effectively uses multiple representations and explanations that capture key ideas in the discipline, guide learners through learning progressions, and promote each learner’s achievement of content standards.

84930517F0BC4BE89A653DEC0B4452B9.description: The teacher is a thoughtful and responsive listener and observer.

70BBD162F6384C82B0524038B9CEA861.description: The teacher seeks to foster respectful communication among all members of the learning community.

DC110A13C3384BE3954D1A41EB8CEC66.description: The teacher is committed to supporting learners as they participate in decision-making, engage in exploration and invention, work collaboratively and independently, and engage in purposeful learning.

C75B8CE63B094ECC909441909CC441D6.description: The teacher values the role of learners in promoting each other’s learning and recognizes the importance of peer relationships in establishing a climate of learning.

4D4452601F4E4EA2AF021CEFF1DB3F8F.description: The teacher is committed to working with learners, colleagues, families, and communities to establish positive and supportive learning environments.

0C17772675674E2FA7213C15E687F625.description: The teacher knows how to use technologies and how to guide learners to apply them in appropriate, safe, and effective ways.

23BCFC260CA54EABA3D5A680573EA872.description: The teacher understands how learner diversity can affect communication and knows how to communicate effectively in differing environments.

9747659019554353AADB9E42B6E4A323.description: The teacher knows how to collaborate with learners to establish and monitor elements of a safe and productive learning environment including norms, expectations, routines, and organizational structures.

78657B7DD47945098CCAA7EEEC1DF4F3.description: The teacher knows how to help learners work productively and cooperatively with each other to achieve learning goals.

5FDD0EB5252A4858AA528EBFC1B20C57.description: The teacher understands the relationship between motivation and engagement and knows how to design learning experiences using strategies that build learner self-direction and ownership of learning.

9396052C4E734F70A3B6C383DA1540E4.description: The teacher intentionally builds learner capacity to collaborate in face-to-face and virtual environments through applying effective interpersonal communication skills.

B211A1A925A14D72B18862A684B10E32.description: The teacher promotes responsible learner use of interactive technologies to extend the possibilities for learning locally and globally.

09127556DB2443F08D05E1F7A2D3D187.description: The teacher communicates verbally and nonverbally in ways that demonstrate respect for and responsiveness to the cultural backgrounds and differing perspectives learners bring to the learning environment.

D59277070651454FAAD2B45462696B87.description: The teacher evaluates and modifi es instructional resources and curriculum materials for their comprehensiveness, accuracy for representing particular concepts in the discipline, and appropriateness for his/her learners.

E2996922D52B41A58EC9EDBFFB3E8BA6.description: The teacher uses a variety of methods to engage learners in evaluating the learning environment and collaborates with learners to make appropriate adjustments.

25008350FCA646EAB9FDB7C4D70B0A5F.description: The teacher collaborates with learners and colleagues to develop shared values and expectations for respectful interactions, rigorous academic discussions, and individual and group responsibility for quality work.

8DCEC61596D44D70BF1F23D066F2A7BE.description: The teacher develops learning experiences that engage learners in collaborative and self-directed learning and that extend learner interaction with ideas and people locally and globally.

EEBE6FF0BE944495AAEFABFB6597B14D.description: The teacher collaborates with learners, families, and colleagues to build a safe, positive learning climate of openness, mutual respect, support, and inquiry.

EE17F4304A064A6BB5CEFEA3AEFF403C.description: The teacher values diverse languages and dialects and seeks to integrate them into his/her instructional practice to engage students in learning

8EB014DC792A4DF5889FF9BD43DCD9D6.description: The teacher makes learners feel valued and helps them learn to value each other.

A3A6CB6E9FAC4431A9753ABF488AAFCD.description: The teacher respects learners as individuals with differing personal and family backgrounds and various skills, abilities, perspectives, talents, and interests

2F8BB9789D5644AC89CECA420DD46CD1.description: The teacher believes that all learners can achieve at high levels and persists in helping each learner reach his/her full potential.

0ACFAAD8415F4BF5938292812995FC5D.description: The teacher knows how to access information about the values of diverse cultures and communities and how to incorporate learners’ experiences, cultures, and community resources into instruction.

3DFAB14A67F84C64BDA14882BAB8CE58.description: The teacher understands that learners bring assets for learning based on their individual experiences, abilities, talents, prior learning, and peer and social group interactions, as well as language, culture, family, and community values

5CCD7B72E5E0457C803CA0B6E88F7525.description: The teacher knows about second language acquisition processes and knows how to incorporate instructional strategies and resources to support language acquisition

9978006B587F472287E520B8C7B7BBD7.description: The teacher understands students with exceptional needs, including those associated with disabilities and giftedness, and knows how to use strategies and resources to address these needs.

F3541D3D02664470B78237C92FB15C3D.description: The teacher understands and identifies differences in approaches to learning and performance and knows how to design instruction that uses each learner’s strengths to promote growth

CB57DAAA5AEC4CDE8144E59299E54EDC.description: The teacher accesses resources, supports, and specialized assistance and services to meet particular learning differences or needs.

91DD4B0586E24096B9CDD4C2289F2E95.description: The teacher incorporates tools of language development into planning and instruction, including strategies for making content accessible to English language learners and for evaluating and supporting their development of English proficiency

18C4EC572FDC4045A22487D38F68047F.description: The teacher brings multiple perspectives to the discussion of content, including attention to learners’ personal, family, and community experiences and cultural norms.

8FF7E64DC19B44D09DAF91FB7EEE4855.description: The teacher designs instruction to build on learners’ prior knowledge and experiences, allowing learners to accelerate as they demonstrate their understandings.

F261620017794A21B00F6A7661D132C6.description: The teacher makes appropriate and timely provisions (e.g., pacing for individual rates of growth, task demands, communication, assessment, and response modes) for individual students with particular learning differences or needs.

A7FDE2D2E80640FA9DE363FA21F66CB6.description: The teacher designs, adapts, and delivers instruction to address each student’s diverse learning strengths and needs and creates opportunities for students to demonstrate their learning in different ways

86F8A760B08144E79ED2C89DADC9EEA0.description: Learning Differences: The teacher uses understanding of individual differences and diverse cultures and communities to ensure inclusive learning environments that enable each learner to meet high standards.

6712F77373FC46BF92ACAF0C263B767B.description: The teacher values the input and contributions of families, colleagues, and other professionals in understanding and supporting each learner’s development

63E03511A5364BCDBF2F24CD1D078206.description: The teacher takes responsibility for promoting learners’ growth and development.

D675BC346D51409284E9B7A59D6A1422.description: The teacher is committed to using learners’ strengths as a basis for growth, and their misconceptions as opportunities for learning

1DB3DC2DDE3F413A9DA53BB489876787.description: The teacher respects learners’ differing strengths and needs and is committed to using this information to further each learner’s development

7190FC33E4B04E679A4B8CF03FF0A2E2.description:
The teacher understands the role of language and culture in learning and knows how to modify instruction to make language comprehensible and instruction relevant, accessible, and challenging.
1.cd: critical dispositions

EA267EDFF76B4E69B18804CB7ABD08E9.description: The teacher identifies readiness for learning, and understands how development in any one area may affect performance in others

7164EFF5694B49C6A3A4D7A58FE62F97.description: The teacher understands that each learner’s cognitive, linguistic, social, emotional, and physical development influences learning and knows how to make instructional decisions that build on learners’ strengths and needs.

2746253BD0024527A509E9F14BEDA06E.description: The teacher understands how learning occurs--how learners construct knowledge, acquire skills, and develop disciplined thinking processes--and knows how to use instructional strategies that promote student learning

3C807DE4CA0A468EB98930AF7EDE84AA.description: The teacher collaborates with families, communities, colleagues, and other professionals to promote learner growth and development.

EB847EA1082344B88201F6421AC54EDA.description: The teacher creates developmentally appropriate instruction that takes into account individual learners’ strengths, interests, and needs and that enables each learner to advance and accelerate his/her learning.

BB45A1ED0BBD48A0A7D96A2C2EDE6182.description: The teacher regularly assesses individual and group performance in order to design and modify instruction to meet learners’ needs in each area of development (cognitive, linguistic, social, emotional, and physical) and scaffolds the next level of development.

E3A7A3899D274596A9B6359EBA48A88E.description: Learner Development - The teacher understands how learners grow and develop, recognizing that patterns of learning and development vary individually within and across the cognitive, linguistic, social, emotional, and physical areas, and designs and implements developmentally appropriate and challenging learning experiences.
